name: JEE Main
info:
Mode: Online (CBT)
Subjects: Physics, Chemistry, Maths
Total Questions: 75 (25 each)
Marking Scheme: +4 ✅, -1 ❌
Total Marks: 300

Approx. Marks for 99%ile (Top Colleges): Around 190-210+

Eligibility Criteria: Passed 10+2 or equivalent with PCM as compulsory subjects.

Participating Institutes: NITs, IIITs, GFTIs and many state engineering colleges.

Application Period: October 28, 2024 to February 25, 2025 (Session 2)

Admit Card Release: March 28, 2025 & April 3, 2025 (for different exam dates)

Result Declaration: By April 17, 2025

name: IIITH UGEE
info:
Mode: Online
Part 1: Logical Reasoning (60 mins)
Part 2: Subject Proficiency (60 mins)
Marking Scheme: Varies by section
Total Marks: N/A
Total Questions: N/A

Approx. Marks for 99%ile (Top Colleges): N/A (IIITH admissions are also based on interview)

Eligibility Criteria: Passed 10+2 or equivalent with Maths and one of Physics/Chemistry/Biology/Computer Science.

Programs Offered: B.Tech. in Computer Science (CS), Electronics and Communication Engineering (ECE), Dual Degree programs.

Selection Process: Based on UGEE score and interview (for some programs).

Application Period: February 4, 2025 to March 23, 2025

Admit Card Release: April 10, 2025

name: MHTCET
info:
Mode: Online
Subjects: PCM
Total Questions: 150 (50 per subject)
Marking Scheme: +1 ✅, No negative
Total Marks: 150

Approx. Marks for 99%ile (Top Colleges): Around 130-140+

Eligibility Criteria: Passed 10+2 or equivalent with PCM as compulsory subjects.

Participating Institutes: Engineering and Technology colleges across Maharashtra.

Application Period: December 30, 2024 to February 27, 2025 (with late fee)

Admit Card Release: April 9, 2025 (PCM)

Result Declaration: Tentatively June 2025

name: MET S1
info:
Mode: Online
Subjects: Physics, Chemistry, Maths, English, General Aptitude
Total Questions: 60
Marking Scheme: +4 ✅, -1 ❌
Total Marks: 240

Approx. Marks for 99%ile (Top Colleges): Around 160-180+

Eligibility Criteria: Passed 10+2 or equivalent with Physics, Chemistry and Mathematics as compulsory subjects with a minimum of 50% marks in aggregate.

Participating Institutes: Manipal Institute of Technology (MIT), Manipal and other constituent units of MAHE.

Application Period: October 14, 2024 to March 28, 2025

Admit Card Release: April 15 to 19, 2025

Result Declaration: Second week of June 2025

name: VITEEE
info:
Mode: Online
Subjects: PCM, English, Aptitude
Total Questions: 125
Marking Scheme: +1 ✅, No negative
Total Marks: 125

Approx. Marks for 99%ile (Top Colleges): Around 95-105+

Eligibility Criteria: Passed 10+2 or equivalent with Physics, Chemistry and Mathematics/Biology as compulsory subjects with a minimum aggregate of 45% marks (40% for reserved categories).

Participating Institutes: Vellore Institute of Technology (VIT) campuses at Vellore, Chennai, Andhra Pradesh and Bhopal.

Application Period: November 4, 2024 to April 7, 2025

Admit Card Release: April 2025 (after slot booking)

Result Declaration: Tentatively April 30, 2025

name: COMEDK UGET
info:
Mode: Online
Subjects: PCM
Total Questions: 180 (60 per subject)
Marking Scheme: +1 ✅, No negative
Total Marks: 180

Approx. Marks for 99%ile (Top Colleges): Around 140-150+

Eligibility Criteria: Passed 10+2 or equivalent with Physics, Chemistry and Mathematics as compulsory subjects with a minimum of 45% marks in aggregate (40% for reserved categories of Karnataka).

Participating Institutes: Private unaided engineering colleges in Karnataka.

Application Period: Usually starts in February/March (Dates not yet confirmed for 2025)

Admit Card Release: Usually in April/May (Dates not yet confirmed for 2025)

Result Declaration: Usually in May (Dates not yet confirmed for 2025)

name: MET S2
info:
Mode: Online
Subjects: Physics, Chemistry, Maths, English, General Aptitude
Total Questions: 60
Marking Scheme: +4 ✅, -1 ❌
Total Marks: 240

Approx. Marks for 99%ile (Top Colleges): Around 160-180+

Eligibility Criteria: Passed 10+2 or equivalent with Physics, Chemistry and Mathematics as compulsory subjects with a minimum of 50% marks in aggregate.

Participating Institutes: Manipal Institute of Technology (MIT), Manipal and other constituent units of MAHE.

Application Period: March 30, 2025 to April 20, 2025

Admit Card Release: May 9, 2025

Result Declaration: May 2025

name: JEE Adv
info:
Mode: Online
Papers: 2 (PCM)
Duration: 3 hours each
Marking Scheme: Variable (SCQ, MCQ, Numerical Answer Type, Integer Type, Matrix Match Type, Paragraph Based) (+4 +3 +2 +1 0 -1 -2 for ✅; 0 or -1 -2 for ❌)
Total Marks: 360 (Approx. for both papers)
Total Questions: Varies each year and by paper

Approx. Marks for 99%ile (Top Colleges): Around 140-160+

Eligibility Criteria: Only top 2,50,000 rank holders (including all categories) in JEE Main (Paper-I) are eligible.

Participating Institutes: Indian Institutes of Technology (IITs).

Application Period: Usually starts after the JEE Main results are declared (Dates not yet fully confirmed for 2025)

Admit Card Release: Usually a week or two before the exam (Dates not yet fully confirmed for 2025)

Result Declaration: Usually in June (Dates not yet fully confirmed for 2025)

name: BITSAT S1
info:
Mode: Online
Subjects: PCM, English, Logical Reasoning
Total Questions: 130
Marking Scheme: +3 ✅, -1 ❌. NOTE: There might be bonus questions with different marking.
Total Marks: 390

Approx. Marks for 99%ile (Top Colleges): Around 280-320+

Eligibility Criteria: Passed 10+2 or equivalent with Physics, Chemistry and Mathematics as compulsory subjects with at least 60% aggregate marks and at least 75% marks in PCM.

Participating Institutes: Birla Institute of Technology and Science (BITS) Pilani (Pilani campus, Goa campus, Hyderabad campus).

Application Period: Usually starts in January/February (Dates for 2025 not yet fully released)

Admit Card Release: Usually a few days before the exam date (Dates for 2025 not yet fully released)

Result Declaration: Score is immediately displayed after the exam; official results and admission details are released later (Dates for 2025 not yet fully released)

name: BITSAT S2
info:
Mode: Online
Subjects: PCM, English, Logical Reasoning
Total Questions: 130
Marking Scheme: +3 ✅, -1 ❌. NOTE: There might be bonus questions with different marking.
Total Marks: 390

Approx. Marks for 99%ile (Top Colleges): Around 280-320+

Eligibility Criteria: Same as BITSAT S1.

Participating Institutes: Birla Institute of Technology and Science (BITS) Pilani (Pilani campus, Goa campus, Hyderabad campus).

Application Period: Usually starts after the completion of BITSAT S1 (Dates for 2025 not yet fully released)

Admit Card Release: Usually a few days before the exam date (Dates for 2025 not yet fully released)

Result Declaration: Score is immediately displayed after the exam; official results and admission details are released later (Dates for 2025 not yet fully released)
